ptz_calibration_h.intro_Txt: PTZ Calibration is alignment of camera's Pan, Tilt and Zoom mechanics in order to get a better orientation accuracy between objects in Overview mode and Normal view. PTZ calibration can be done initially when accessing the product for the first time or later on through System Options > Maintenance > Calibrate PTZ.
ptz_calibration_h.calibStep1: Use the buttons Rotate right and Rotate left to adjust the image orientation in Overview mode. Click next button to go to the next PTZ calibration step.
ptz_calibration_h.calibStep2: Click an object inside the small circle in overview mode. Make sure to remember the object you have clicked because you will be required to click on the same object again in the next step.
ptz_calibration_h.calibStep3: Click on the same object again in normal mode. Note that, this should be the same object that you clicked in the previous step.
ptz_calibration_h.calibStep4: Repeat steps 2 and 3 until PTZ calibration is finished, that is, the Finish button becomes active.
ptz_calibration_h.calibStep5: Click Finish, to complete the PTZ calibration.
